<file id="1" change="false">
<text id="0">
	CANCEL
</text>
<text id="1">
	\v0205\x0000UNOWN Report
</text>
<text id="2">
	\v0103ぁ\x0000\x0000
</text>
<text id="3">
	\v0205\x0000 Number of UNOWN
</text>
<text id="4">
	\v0205\x0000Current Kinds: \v0133ぁ\x0000\x0000
</text>
<text id="5">
	\v0205\x0000\v0132ぁ\x0000\x0000/\v0132ぁ\x0001\x0000
</text>
<text id="6">
	Found a strange puzzle in the\nruins. Solved it, and suddenly a\nhole opened up in the ground\nand I dropped into the room\nbelow! Should have known that\nancient ruins would have\nsurprising tricks like that.
</text>
<text id="7">
	There was a stone statue where I\nfell. The place might have been a\nreception hall. Then, suddenly,\nthe UNOWN appeared. That puzzle\nwas like a key somehow. It woke\nthe UNOWN up from their sleep.\nThese ruins have become difficult.
</text>
<text id="8">
	If you turn on the radio in the\nruins, you can receive mysterious\nradio waves! It’s proof that the\nUNOWN communicate with each\nother using radio waves!
</text>
<text id="9">
	There are as many UNOWN as there\nare letters in the alphabet.\nRight now, we’re confirming the\nexistence of 26 kinds of UNOWN.\nDo you think you can find\nall 26 of them?
</text>
<text id="10">
	It seems that individually they\ndon’t make much sense, but when\nthe various UNOWN are arranged\nin order, they begin to make\nsense. In nature, they seem to be\nscattered around randomly, but\nthe truth is they’re arranged in\na very specific order.
</text>
<text id="11">
	In this report, the scattered\nUNOWN were sorted and put into\norder by the research-center\nstaff. That makes the UNOWN much\neasier to understand.
</text>
<text id="12">
	Scratched on the floor of the\nruins are UNOWN letters. Finding\nthe room feels like a huge\ndiscovery! The Researchers were\nvery excited and said they were\ngoing to go check it out.
</text>
<text id="13">
	There aren’t just 26 different\nkinds of UNOWN. Two more have\nbeen discovered! But that begs\nthe question of where those\nother two kinds are hiding...
</text>
<text id="14">
	\v0204\x0001しThe characters found scratched\non the floor in the small room are\ntranscribed here in this report.
</text>
<text id="15">
	\v0204\x0001ょOUR FRIENDS LOOK\nUP AND HEARTILY\nCONGRATULATE US
</text>
<text id="16">
	\v0204\x0001デWe don’t know what this could\npossibly mean yet.
</text>
<text id="17">
	The Researchers were saying\nthat they’ll need to examine the\nruins again, but...?
</text>
<text id="18">
	In the past, it seems that UNOWN\nlived with relatives of humans in\nthese ruins. In the lower levels\nof these ruins is a Pokémon\nstatue. We’ve come to understand\nthat it was those relatives who\nmade that statue.
</text>
<text id="19">
	The UNOWN are very timid\ncreatures, so they don’t go\noutside the ruins. Even if a bunch\nof people gathered near the\nruins, it is said that the ones who\nwished for UNOWN and humans to\nagain coexist have all left.
</text>

<text id="0">
	Quit
</text>
<text id="1">
	This Pokémon hides on the\nseafloor and watches the\nshore with eyes on its back.
</text>
<text id="2">
	This Pokémon knew no fear\nand flew as it pleased\nthrough the skies long ago.
</text>
<text id="3">
	A ten-legged Pokémon that\nswims on the bottom of the\nsea and eats plankton.
</text>
<text id="4">
	This Pokémon, with feathers\nof seven colors, flies through\nthe sky, according to legend.
</text>
<text id="5">
	Are you sure you would like to quit?
</text>

<text id="0">
	Welcome to the Battle Castle.\nMy name is Darach.\rI will be your host on behalf of Lady\nCaitlin, the owner of the castle.\rFirst, I must ask you for any items\nyour Pokémon are holding.\rThey will be returned to you when you\nleave.\rNext, I have here 10 Castle Points, CP,\nthat can be used only here.\rThey are for you.\nPlease accept them.\r
</text>
<text id="1">
	Welcome.\r\v0103ぁ\x0000\x0000, as per the rules, I must\nask for your Pokémon’s held items.\rThey will be returned to you when you\nleave.\rI also have for you 10 Castle Points,\nCP, that can only be used here.\r
</text>
<text id="2">
	Please wait a moment.
</text>
<text id="3">
	Very well.\nPlease proceed.
</text>
<text id="4">
	Your fainted Pokémon will be\nrevived.\r
</text>
<text id="5">
	Coming up is battle no. \v0135ぁ\x0000\x0000.\nI trust you are ready?
</text>
<text id="6">
	Would you care to save the last battle\nas your Battle Video?
</text>
<text id="7">
	\v0103ぁ\x0000\x0000’s battle has been saved\nas a Battle Video.\r
</text>
<text id="8">
	There was an error.\nThe Battle Video couldn’t be saved.\r
</text>
<text id="9">
	Would you care to delete your existing\nBattle Video and save the last battle?
</text>
<text id="10">
	Saving...\nPlease do not turn the power off.

</text>
<text id="35">

</text>
<text id="36">

<text id="37">

</text>
<text id="38">

</text>
<text id="39">
	Lady Caitlin has instructed me to award\nyou \v0133ぁ\x0000\x0000 CP.
</text>
<text id="40">
	Darach: Congratulations on clearing\nseven consecutive battles.\rFor your valiant effort, \v0103ぁ\x0000\x0000,\nplease accept this BP.\r

<text id="41">
	\v0103ぁ\x0000\x0000 received \v0133ぁ\x0001\x0000 BP!\r

<text id="53">
	Darach: \v0103ぁ\x0000\x0000, congratulations!\rYou are to be commended on your\nmastery for keeping the streak alive.\rOur owner, appreciating your worth,\ndemands you battle the Castle Valet.\rYou are prepared, yes?\r
</text>
<text id="54">
	Darach: Welcome.\rI am Darach, as you know, and I am\nthe Castle Valet.\rLady Caitlin, my employer, is not one\nto accept defeat willingly.\rHowever, for a reason I’m not at\nliberty to disclose, she cannot battle.\rConsequently, I will do battle in her\nladyship’s place.\r...Let me assure you that you won’t be\nshortchanged by facing me.\rEn garde!\r
</text>
<text id="55">
	Darach: Your mastery of Pokémon is as\nbreathtaking as ever.\r\v0103ぁ\x0000\x0000, you certainly are to be\ncommended.\r...However, if I may say so, I noticed\nsomething about the way you battle.\rAfter all, I have had the opportunity\nto watch you closely firsthand.\rSo, what is it that I noticed?\rAs a Trainer myself, it is but proper\netiquette to show you in a battle.\rLet us begin!\nEn garde!\r
</text>
<text id="56">
	Darach: \v0103ぁ\x0000\x0000, you are truly in\npossession of a superlative talent!\rI drew on every reserve of experience\nand etiquette handed down through\lour heritage of glorious servitude.\rBut even then, I failed to fend off your\ninspired and inspiring challenge.\rI shall see to appeasing Lady Caitlin’s\ndispleasure at my loss.\r\v0103ぁ\x0000\x0000, please do return to our\nBattle Castle.\rWe will be delighted and feel privileged\nto have you back!\r
</text>
<text id="57">
	Darach: I am humbled...\rWhat I’d perceived to be a weakness\nwas only illusory...\rOr, perhaps you corrected it in the\ncourse of our battle.\rRegardless, your performance was\nstunning again.\rThough she cannot say it, Lady Caitlin\nappears quite taken by your style.\rFor her sake at the very least, please\ndo return to our Battle Castle!\r
</text>

<text id="0">
	\v0205\x0000VOLTORB Flip Lv. \v0132ぁ\x0000\x0000
</text>
<text id="1">
	\v0205\x0000Flip the Cards and Collect Coins!
</text>

	...x1! ...x2! ...x3!
</text>
<text id="3">
	Game Over! 0!
</text>

	\v0205\x0000\v0103ぁ\x0000\x0000’s\n\v0205\x0000Collected Coins
</text>
<text id="5">
	\v0205\x0000Coins Collected in\n\v0205\x0000Current Game
</text>
<text id="6">
	\v0205\x0000Open\n\v0205\x0000Memo
</text>
<text id="7">
	\v0205\x0000Close\n\v0205\x0000Memo
</text>
<text id="8">
	\v0205\x0000Quit
</text>
<text id="9">
	\v0205\x0000By looking at the numbers on the sides of\n\v0205\x0000the cards, you can see the hidden number\n\v0205\x0000and VOLTORB totals.
</text>
<text id="10">
	\v0205\x0000Touch “Open Memo” to open the Memo Window.\n\v0205\x0000Touch the cards to add and remove marks.
</text>
<text id="11">
	\v0205\x0000If you flip the cards in this order,\n\v0205\x0000you’ll collect: 3 x 1 x 2 x 1 x 3...\n\v0205\x0000A total of 18 Coins! And then...
</text>
<text id="12">
	\v0205\x0000If you select “Quit,”\n\v0205\x0000you’ll keep those 18 Coins.
</text>
<text id="13">
	\v0205\x0000But if you find VOLTORB,\n\v0205\x0000you’ll lose all your Coins!

<text id="14">

</text>
<text id="15">
	Play VOLTORB Flip Lv. \v0132ぁ\x0000\x0000?
</text>
<text id="16">
	Play VOLTORB Flip Lv. \v0132ぁ\x0000\x0000?
</text>
<text id="17">
	Play
</text>
<text id="18">
	Game Info
</text>
<text id="19">
	Quit
</text>
<text id="20">
	Which set of info?
</text>
<text id="21">
	How to Play
</text>
<text id="22">
	Hint!
</text>
<text id="23">
	About Memos
</text>
<text id="24">
	Return
</text>
<text id="25">
	VOLTORB Flip is a game in which you flip\nover cards to find numbers hidden\lbeneath them.\rThe cards are hiding the numbers\n1 through 3...and VOLTORB as well.\rThe first number you flip over will give\nyou that many Coins.\rFrom then on, the next number you\nfind will multiply the total amount of\lCoins you’ve collected by that number.\rIf it’s a 2, your total will be multiplied\nby “x2.”\rIf it’s a 3, your total will be multiplied\nby “x3.”\rBut if you flip over a VOLTORB, it’s\ngame over.\rWhen that happens, you’ll lose all the\nCoins you’ve collected in the\lcurrent game.\rIf you select “Quit,” you’ll withdraw\nfrom the game.\rIf you get to a difficult spot, you might\nwant to end the game early.\rOnce you’ve found all the hidden\n2 and 3 cards, you’ve cleared\lthe game.\rOnce you’ve flipped over all these\ncards, then you’ll advance to the\lnext level.\rAs you move up in levels, you will be\nable to receive more Coins.\lDo your best!\r
</text>
<text id="26">
	The numbers at the side of the board\ngive you a clue about the numbers\lhidden on the backs of the panels.\rThe larger the number, the more likely\nit is that there are many large numbers\lhidden in that row or column.\rIn the same way, you can tell how many\nVOLTORB are hidden in the row\lor column.\rConsider the hidden number totals and\nthe VOLTORB totals carefully as you flip\lover panels.\r
</text>
<text id="27">
	Select “Open Memo” to mark\nthe cards.\rYou can mark the cards with the\nnumbers 1 through 3, but also with a\lVOLTORB mark.\rWhen you have an idea of the numbers\nhidden on the back of the cards, touch\r“Open Memo” and select the cards\nto mark.\rIf you want to remove a mark, touch the\nmark again, and it will disappear.\r
</text>

	JOIN A MULTI BATTLE
</text>
<text id="5">
	CANCEL
</text>
<text id="6">
	There are five Battle Modes.\rSingle Battle is for two Trainers\nwith one or more Pokémon each.\rEach Trainer can have one Pokémon\nin battle at a time.\rDouble Battle is for two Trainers\nwith two or more Pokémon each.\rEach Trainer will send out two\nPokémon to battle at a time.\rMix Battle is for two Trainers\nwith three Pokémon each.\rEach Trainer chooses one of the\nopponent’s Pokémon, mixes them\lwith their own party, and then\lbattles the other Trainer.\rFlat Battle is for Pokémon over Lv. 50.\rAll Pokémon will become Lv. 50 for\nthe battle.\rMulti Battle is for four Trainers\nwith one or more Pokémon each.\rEach Trainer can have one Pokémon\nin battle at a time.\r
</text>

<text id="3">
	The Battle Tower is a facility for Single\nor Double Battle challenges.\rOnce entered, your challenge lasts\nuntil you lose.\rIn Single Battle format, you enter with\nthree Pokémon.\rIn Double Battle format, you enter with\nfour Pokémon.\rThe battles are held in Battle Rooms,\nof which there are many in the tower.\rIn each of the Battle Rooms, seven\nTrainers await your challenge.\rIf you manage to defeat all seven,\nyou will earn Battle Points (BP).\rIf you want to interrupt your\nchallenge, please save the game.\rIf you don’t save, you will be\ndisqualified from your challenge.\rPlease be aware of that!\r
</text>

	The Battle Tower’s Wi-Fi Battle Rooms\nare places to conduct battles over\lNintendo Wi-Fi Connection.\rAs a result, you will be battling\nTrainers from around the world.\rInside the Battle Tower, there are\nmany Battle Rooms.\rIn each of the Battle Rooms, seven\nTrainers await your challenge.\rIf you manage to defeat all seven,\nyou will earn Battle Points.\rDepending on how you do, you may\neven become the room’s leader!\rAlso, the Wi-Fi Battle Rooms are\noperated on a ranking system.\rTrainers will go up in rank if they\nkeep winning Wi-Fi Battles.\rContrarily, their rankings could go\ndown if they lose consistently.\rTo raise your rank, keep winning,\nespecially against tougher Trainers.\rIf you want to interrupt your\nchallenge, please save the game.\rIf you don’t save, you will be\ndisqualified from your challenge.\r

	Battle Tower... It’s so tall!\nI wonder how many times my height it is?
</text>
<text id="1">
	All the places in the Battle Frontier\nlet you team up with a friend!\lThat’s so cool, don’t you think?\lI wish I had a friend to team up with...
</text>
<text id="2">
	I am the super Idol in Johto!\rI’ve come all the way to the\nBattle Frontier to promote my\llatest song!\rBut...\rEverybody seems to be a\nPoké Maniac here!
</text>
<text id="3">
	Fishing won’t keep me calm since I came\nto know about the Battle Frontier.\lWhen I go fishing, I find myself quitting\learly and coming here.
</text>
<text id="4">
	The place I like best among the five\nfacilities here would be the\lBattle Castle, because you can see\lLady Caitlin there!
</text>
<text id="5">
	What makes me the most happy being\na Trainer?\rThe fact that Pokémon will always bring\nme lots of friends!
</text>
<text id="6">
	Just like people go through different\nthings they can learn from, Pokémon\llearn different things from battles.\rBehind every experience, there is a\nstory. Isn’t that right, dear?
</text>
<text id="7">
	All experiences lead to a tale.\nI’m not wrong, am I, dear?
</text>
<text id="8">
	I’ve come to the Battle Frontier to\nget a job!\rThanks to my previous job, I’m good\nat cooking, cleaning, and laundry!
</text>
<text id="9">
	To be strong is to be weak.\nTo be weak is to be strong.\rSomebody told me that before.\nI don’t quite understand it yet,\lbut it sounds deep.\rI’ll just give myself some time\nto figure it out.
</text>
<text id="10">
	Watching these people who care so much\nabout Pokémon makes me feel ashamed\lof my selfishness.\rI’ll try and face my Pokémon for real!
</text>
<text id="11">
	I wonder how many years it’s been since\nI first met a Pokémon? ...Forty-nine!\rOh, I lost the page that kept track of\nhow many years, days, and hours...\rCould it be my Pokémon nibbling on it?
</text>
<text id="12">
	Trainers care about Pokémon\nas the battle progresses.\rIn return, Pokémon repay that trust\nby using moves the best they can.\rWhat you see in a battle is the trust\nbetween people and Pokémon.\rThis may seem obvious, but it’s actually\nincredibly amazing!
</text>
<text id="13">
	You cannot try anything if you are\nafraid of losing battles.\rBut!\rGetting into a battle knowing you have\nno chance of winning will only make your\lPokémon suffer.\rThat’s not courage!\nTruly good Trainers know the balance\lbetween courage and cautiousness.
</text>
<text id="14">
	If you want to graduate from being\na so-so Trainer, mark my words!\rThe Pokémon’s type!\rThe moves to be learned!\rThe items to be held!\rYou can’t overlook a single detail.
</text>
<text id="15">
	When people win a battle, some laugh\nat their opponent.\rSome brag about his or her strengths.\rSome even start to dance around \nclaiming he or she is number one\lin the world.\rI respect people who win and then\ncare about their opponent.
</text>
<text id="16">
	Have you heard of the Brains of the\nBattle Frontier?\rThere are five facilities in the\nBattle Frontier.\rAt every one, you can win your way\nthrough to challenge the bosses\lcalled the Frontier Brains.\lThey’re out-of-this-world tough!
</text>
<text id="17">
	Allowing us to enjoy battles,\nhelping us work,\ltaking us to places far away,\lor just being good friends...\rPokémon are so deep.\nI wanna be like Pokémon.
</text>
<text id="18">
	At the Battle Factory, you have to\nkeep winning with rental Pokémon.\rI may not stand a chance at other\nfacilities, but I may go all the\lway here!
</text>
<text id="19">
	The Battle Hall is where Pokémon battle\none-on-one for as long as they can.\rEven my MAGIKARP has a shot at\nnumber one!\rWow!\rJust the thought of it makes\nme excited!
</text>
<text id="20">
	Life is full of ebbs and flows.\nI’ll keep my inflatable tube close.\rI could call it the wisdom I gained\nin the last five years of my life.
</text>

<file id="103" change="false">
<text id="0">
	Welcome to the Battle Frontier!\rThis is your first visit?\nRight this way, please!\r
</text>
<text id="1">
	Oh! You have a Vs. Recorder!\nHow nice!\rWe upgrade Vs. Recorders for first-time\nvisitors for Battle Frontier use.\rI’ll borrow yours for a moment.\rLet’s see... Slide open this part here,\nand ticka-tacka-kachunk there!\rAll done!\nHere you go.\r
</text>
<text id="2">
	\v0103ぁ\x0000\x0000’s Vs. Recorder was\nupgraded.
</text>
<text id="3">
	Our other staff will be pleased to\nexplain how the individual facilities\lof the Battle Frontier operate.\rI can go over general topics.\nDo you have any questions? \v0200\x0001\x0000
</text>
<text id="4">
	Which topic should I explain? \v0200\x0001\x0000
</text>
<text id="5">
	The Battle Frontier has five facilities\ndedicated to battling.\rAt the Battle Tower, the objective is\nto beat seven Trainers in a row.\rAt the Battle Hall, you may keep battle\nrecords of individual Pokémon.\rAt the Battle Factory, you must win\nconsecutive battles with rentals.\rThe Battle Castle forces Trainers to\nmanage Castle Points to advance.\rAnd finally, the Battle Arcade is where\nrandom luck triggers events.\rYou can try any of these facilities!\r
</text>
<text id="6">
	The battles at the five Battle Frontier\nfacilities are held under special rules.\rFirst and foremost, no Exp. Points\ncan be earned.\rConsequently, the Pokémon battling\nhere will not level up.\rIf the Level 50 rule is chosen,\nPokémon of higher levels will be\ltemporarily reduced to Lv. 50.\rPokémon under Lv. 50 will be entered\nwithout an upward level adjustment.\r
</text>
<text id="7">
	Battle Points are usually referred to\nas BP.\rBP are points that are used only in\nthe Battle Frontier.\rBP are awarded for meeting certain\nperformance goals at the various\lBattle Frontier facilities.\rBP can be exchanged for prizes at\nthe Exchange Service Corner.\r
</text>
<text id="8">
	The Exchange Service Corner is\ncomprised of two tents straight\lahead past here.\rThere, you may exchange your BP for\na wide variety of prizes.\rPlease do visit it!\r
</text>
<text id="9">
	The Performance Monitor shows Trainer\ndata, such as the previous record and\lthe best record to date.\rYou will find one near the reception\ncounter in each facility.\r
</text>
<text id="10">
	We hope you enjoy your visit!
</text>
<text id="11">
	           
</text>
<text id="12">
	         
</text>
<text id="13">

<text id="14">

<text id="16">

<text id="17">
	Welcome to the Battle Frontier!\rShould I explain how the\nBattle Tower works? \v0200\x0001\x0000
</text>
<text id="18">
	The Battle Tower is the building at the\nback of the Battle Frontier.\rThe object here is to enter a team of\ndifferent Pokémon and battle on until\lyou lose.\r
</text>
<text id="19">
	We hope you enjoy your visit!
</text>
<text id="20">
	Welcome to the Battle Frontier!\rShould I explain how the\nBattle Factory works? \v0200\x0001\x0000
</text>
<text id="21">
	The Battle Factory is at the upper-\nright corner of the Battle Frontier.\rThere, you engage in a knockout\ntournament with rented Pokémon.\rThe goal is to keep winning for\nas long as possible.\rEvery time you win a match, you may\ntrade one of your Pokémon for one of\lthe opponent’s Pokémon.\r
</text>
<text id="22">
	We hope you enjoy your visit!
</text>
<text id="23">
	Welcome to the Battle Frontier!\rShould I explain how the\nBattle Hall works? \v0200\x0001\x0000
</text>
<text id="24">
	The Battle Hall is at the upper-left\ncorner of the Battle Frontier.\rHere, you enter one Pokémon of your\nchoosing for one-on-one battles.\rThe objective is to keep your winning\nstreak going as long as possible.\r
</text>
<text id="25">
	We hope you enjoy your visit!
</text>
<text id="26">
	Welcome to the Battle Frontier!\rShould I explain how the\nBattle Castle works? \v0200\x0001\x0000
</text>
<text id="27">
	The Battle Castle is at the lower-left\ncorner of the Battle Frontier.\rHere, you are provided with Castle\nPoints, CP, that you must manage.\rThe CP are used for healing Pokémon,\nrenting items or Berries, and so on.\rThe objective is to keep a winning\nstreak alive while managing your CP.\r
</text>
<text id="28">
	We hope you enjoy your visit!
</text>
<text id="29">
	Welcome to the Battle Frontier!\rShould I explain how the\nBattle Arcade works? \v0200\x0001\x0000
</text>
<text id="30">
	The Battle Arcade is at the lower-right\ncorner of the Battle Frontier.\rHere, a game board is activated\nbefore every match.\rDepending on what comes up on the\ngame board, an event takes place.\rSome events will be good to the\nchallenger, while others won’t be.\rThe challenger may even avoid having\nto battle at all.\rThe objective is to keep a winning\nstreak alive as long as possible.\r
</text>
<text id="31">
	We hope you enjoy your visit!
</text>
<text id="32">
	The Battle Frontier is up ahead!\nI have explored places all over the\lworld, but nothing compares to the\lexcitement I feel right now!\rWhat kinds of Trainers will I see?\nWhat battles will I experience?\rIt’s a whole new adventure for me!
</text>
<text id="33">
	The five facilities of the Battle\nFrontier are...\rTower.\rHall.\rCastle.\rFactory.\rAnd Arcade.\rHow do you make an acronym out of\nthat? THCFA?\rRearrange those letters, maybe?\nFATCH! CHAFT!\r...Nope! Nothing works!\nDidn’t anyone think of this?!
</text>
<text id="34">
	The Vs. Recorder is sure nifty!\rChecking the Frontier Record\nwill tell you how much BP you have.
</text>
<text id="35">
	My dream is to battle Palmer of the\nBattle Tower.\rI want to record it for posterity on\nmy Vs. Recorder.\rBut I left my Vs. Recorder\nat home... I’m heartbroken!
</text>

<file id="107" change="false">
<text id="0">
	Welcome to the Battle Factory!\rI am your guide to the Single and\nDouble Battle challenges.\rPlease be aware that these challenges\nare designed for a single Trainer.\r
</text>
<text id="1">
	Which challenge would\nyou like to take? \v0200\x0001\x0000
</text>
<text id="2">
	At the Battle Factory, you may take\nSingle or Double Battle challenges\lusing rental Pokémon.\rOnce entered, your challenge lasts\nuntil you lose.\rAfter each win, you may trade a rented\nPokémon for one of the opponent’s.\rThe Level 50 option starts you off with\nPokémon that only know weak moves.\rThe Open Level option gives you access\nto Lv. 100 Pokémon with powerful moves\lfrom the start.\rIf you manage to win seven matches in\na row, you will earn Battle Points (BP).\rIf you want to interrupt your\nchallenge, please save the game.\rIf you don’t save, you will be\ndisqualified from your challenge.\rPlease be aware of that!\r
</text>
<text id="3">
	Welcome to the Battle Factory!\rI am your guide to the Multi Battle\nchallenge.\rPlease be aware that this challenge\nrequires two Trainers.\r
</text>
<text id="4">
	Would you like to take the Battle\nFactory Multi Battle challenge? \v0200\x0001\x0000
</text>
<text id="5">
	You may team up with a friend for a\nMulti Battle challenge using rental\lPokémon.\rBoth partners will be provided with two\nrental Pokémon each.\rOnce entered, you and your partner\nconduct Multi Battles until you lose.\rAfter each win, you or your partner\nmay trade a single rented Pokémon.\rIf you manage to win seven matches in\na row, you will earn Battle Points (BP).\rThe Level 50 option starts with rental\nPokémon that only know weak moves.\rThe Open Level option lets you rent\nLv. 100 Pokémon with powerful moves\lfrom the start.\rPlease note: a Battle Factory Multi\nBattle challenge can’t be interrupted.\r
</text>
<text id="6">
	We hope to see you again!
</text>
<text id="7">
	Which challenge level would you like\nto play? Level 50 or Open Level? \v0200\x0001\x0000
</text>
<text id="8">
	You must save the game before I\nshow you in. Is that OK? \v0200\x0001\x0000
</text>
<text id="9">
	Right this way, please!
</text>
<text id="10">
	We look forward to your next visit.\r
</text>
<text id="11">
	We’ve missed you!\rYou must save the game before you\nresume your challenge. Please wait.
</text>
<text id="12">
	Excuse me!\rYou didn’t save before you quit your\nchallenge last time.\rBecause of that, you have been\ndisqualified from your challenge!\r
</text>
<text id="13">
	Congratulations!\rIn recognition of your victory, we\npresent you this commemorative print!\r
</text>
<text id="14">
	The Gold Print was added to\n\v0103ぁ\x0000\x0000’s Vs. Recorder!\r
</text>
<text id="15">
	The Silver Print was added to\n\v0103ぁ\x0000\x0000’s Vs. Recorder!\r
</text>
<text id="16">
	SINGLE BATTLE
</text>
<text id="17">
	DOUBLE BATTLE
</text>
<text id="18">
	TAKE CHALLENGE
</text>

</text>

</text>

	CANCEL
</text>
<text id="24">
	One Trainer should select\n“BECOME LEADER.”\rThe other Trainer must select\n“JOIN GROUP.” \v0200\x0001\x0000
</text>
<text id="25">
	We need to launch DS Wireless\nCommunications. \v0200\x0001\x0000\n
</text>
<text id="26">
	You must save the game before I\nshow you in. Please wait.
</text>
<text id="27">
	The staff tell you about the next\nTrainer you’ll face.\rThey’re very helpful here.\nDon’t you think?\n
</text>
<text id="28">
	They tell you about the next Trainer\nyou’ll face? That’s really nice.\rYou know, you can prepare for it\nonce you know what kind of Trainer\lthe next one is!
</text>
<text id="29">
	It’ll help you choose a Pokémon when\nyou remember what kind of Pokémon\lthe other Trainer had and what moves\lthey used.
</text>
<text id="30">
	This is a place to battle with rental\nPokémon, right?\rIt is a good chance to try Pokémon\nyou’ve never trained.\rYou’ll learn about new Pokémon\nwhile having exciting battles!\rWhat more could you want?
</text>
<text id="31">
	Do you have a lot of Pokémon?\rI’m not too proud to say this, but...\nI have only a few!\rBut there is nothing to worry about.\nDo you know why?\rThis facility, the Battle Factory, has\nyou use rental Pokémon for battles!
</text>
<text id="32">
	So you have to battle with Pokémon\nyou just met instead of with your\lcherished Pokémon you’ve always\lbattled with?\rOh, I don’t know if I could...\nWill they be nice to me...?\lI’m a little worried.
</text>
<text id="33">
	All the Trainers gathered at the\nBattle Frontier are nice,\lpleasant people!\rI’m patrolling here on duty, but\notherwise I would love to change\lmy uniform to participate!
</text>
</file>
<file id="108" change="false">
<text id="0">
	Welcome to the Battle Hall!\rI am your guide to the Single and\nDouble Battle challenges.\rPlease be aware that these challenges\nare designed for a single Trainer.\r
</text>
<text id="1">
	Which challenge would you\nlike to take?\v0200\x0001\x0000
</text>
<text id="2">
	At the Battle Hall, you may take Single\nor Double Battle challenges alone.\rFor the Single Battle challenge, you\nenter one Pokémon of at least Lv. 30.\rThe Double Battle Challenge requires\nyou to enter two of the same kind of\lPokémon that are at least Lv. 30 each.\rWinning-streak records are kept for\nindividual kinds of Pokémon.\rThat makes it possible for any kind of\nPokémon to aim for no. 1.\rWhen you enter the Hall, you will be\nasked to choose the type and rank of\lthe Pokémon you want to battle.\rIf you manage to win ten matches in\na row, you will earn Battle Points (BP).\rIf you want to interrupt your\nchallenge, please save the game.\rIf you don’t save, you will be\ndisqualified from your challenge.\rPlease be aware of that!\r
</text>
<text id="3">
	Welcome to the Battle Hall!\rI am your guide to the Multi Battle\nchallenge.\rPlease be aware that this challenge\nrequires two Trainers.\r
</text>
<text id="4">
	Would you like to take the Battle\nHall Multi Battle challenge? \v0200\x0001\x0000
</text>
<text id="5">
	You may team up with a friend for a\nMulti Battle challenge using the\lsame kind of Pokémon that are at\lleast Lv. 30 each.\rWhen you enter the Hall, you will be\nasked to choose the type and rank of\lthe Pokémon you want to battle.\rIf you manage to win ten matches in\na row, you will earn Battle Points (BP).\rPlease note: a Battle Hall Multi Battle\nchallenge can’t be interrupted.\r
</text>
<text id="6">
	We hope to see you again!
</text>
<text id="7">
	Which challenge level would you like to\nplay? Level 50 or Open Level?
</text>
<text id="8">
	You must save the game before\nI show you in. Is that OK?\v0200\x0001\x0000
</text>
<text id="9">
	Right this way, please!
</text>
<text id="10">
	We look forward to your next visit.\r
</text>
<text id="11">
	We’ve missed you!\rYou must save the game before you\nresume your challenge. Please wait.

<file id="109" change="false">
<text id="0">
	Welcome to the Battle Castle!\rI am your guide to the Single and\nDouble Battle challenges.\rPlease be aware that these challenges\nare designed for a single Trainer.\r
</text>
<text id="1">
	Which challenge would you\nlike to take? \v0200\x0001\x0000
</text>
<text id="2">
	At the Battle Castle, you may take a\nSingle or Double Battle challenge.\rHere, you are provided with Castle\nPoints (CP) that you must manage.\rThe CP are used for healing Pokémon,\nrenting items or Berries, and so on.\rCP are earned by winning matches.\nThe amount varies by how you win.\rThe objective is to keep a winning\nstreak alive while managing your CP.\rIf you manage to win seven matches in\na row, you will earn Battle Points (BP).\rIf you want to interrupt your\nchallenge, please save the game.\rIf you don’t save, you will be\ndisqualified from your challenge.\rPlease be aware of that!\r
</text>
<text id="3">
	Welcome to the Battle Castle!\rI am your guide to the Multi Battle\nchallenge.\rPlease be aware that this challenge\nrequires two Trainers.\r
</text>
<text id="4">
	Would you like to take the Battle\nCastle Multi Battle challenge? \v0200\x0001\x0000
</text>
<text id="5">
	You may team up with a friend for a\nMulti Battle challenge.\rBoth Trainers are provided with Castle\nPoints (CP) that must be managed.\rThe CP is used for healing Pokémon,\nrenting items or Berries, and so on.\rTrainers can use their CP on not only\ntheir own Pokémon, but also their\lpartner’s.\rBoth Trainers earn CP by winning\nmatches.\rThe objective is to keep a winning\nstreak alive while managing your CP.\rIf you manage to win seven matches in\na row, you will earn Battle Points (BP).\rPlease note: a Battle Castle Multi\nBattle challenge can’t be interrupted.\r
</text>
<text id="6">
	We hope to see you again!
</text>

	Please select the Pokémon you wish\nto enter.\r
</text>

<text id="0">
	Welcome to the Battle Arcade!\rI am your guide to the Single and\nDouble Battle challenges.\rPlease be aware that these challenges\nare designed for a single Trainer.\r
</text>
<text id="1">
	Which challenge would you like\nto take?\v0200\x0001\x0000
</text>
<text id="2">
	At the Battle Arcade, you may take a\nSingle or Double Battle challenge.\rHere, a game board is activated\nbefore every match.\rDepending on what comes up on the\ngame board, an event takes place.\rSome events will be good for the\nchallenger, while others won’t be.\rThe objective is to keep a winning\nstreak alive as long as possible.\rDuring your challenge, any items held by\nyour Pokémon will be kept in storage.\rIf you manage to win seven matches in\na row, you will earn Battle Points (BP).\rIf you want to interrupt your\nchallenge, please save the game.\rIf you don’t save, you will be\ndisqualified from your challenge.\rPlease be aware of that!\r
</text>
<text id="3">
	Welcome to the Battle Arcade!\rI am your guide to the Multi Battle\nchallenge.\rPlease be aware that this challenge\nrequires two Trainers.\r
</text>
<text id="4">
	Would you like to take the Battle\nArcade Multi Battle challenge?\v0200\x0001\x0000
</text>
<text id="5">
	You may team up with a friend for a\nMulti Battle challenge.\rHere, a game board is activated\nbefore every match.\rDepending on what comes up on the\ngame board, an event takes place.\rThe events may have great impact on\nthe match’s outcome, good or bad.\rThe objective is to keep a winning\nstreak alive as long as possible.\rDuring your challenge, any items held by\nyour Pokémon will be kept in storage.\rIf you manage to win seven matches in\na row, you will earn Battle Points (BP).\rPlease note: a Battle Arcade Multi\nBattle challenge can’t be interrupted.\r
</text>

</text>
<text id="8">
	In Hurdle Dash, timing is everything.\rYour Pokémon will pick up speed\nif you let them wait until the last\lmoment before they jump the Hurdles.\r
</text>
<text id="9">
	Pennant Capture...\rThis event is not only about the\nPennants on the beach, but also\lthe ones other Pokémon have collected.\rIf you bump into them from behind,\nthey will be knocked down and your\lPokémon will grab their Pennants.\rThat’s the way experts fight.\r
</text>
<text id="10">
	The key is to push other Pokémon out\nof the Circles...which may be obvious.\rActually, your Pokémon can push harder\nif you pick the right moment to tell\lthem to push.\rSo you might be able to push back\npowerful Pokémon if you give frequent\linstructions to push.\r
</text>
<text id="11">
	Block Smash is not just about smashing.\rDid you ever notice that sometimes\nthere are small cracks in the Blocks?\rWell, if you can hit those cracks,\nthey break real fast!\rIf you can aim at cracks in a row,\nyour Pokémon will feel great and\lthey’ll show great potential.\rOne more thing...\rWhen you make them switch,\nflick your Pokémon upwards\lfor a quicker switch.\r
</text>
<text id="12">
	Disc Catch is about how long you can\nwait until you catch the Discs.\rBird Pokémon can move around in the\nair, so it’ll be easier to catch Discs\lif you form a team of bird Pokémon.\r
</text>
<text id="13">
	Lamp Jump is not only about jumping.\rThere are three Pokémon bouncing\ntogether, so one Pokémon can’t jump\lwell if another comes down right when\lthe other wants to go up in the air.\rLetting them jump at the right time\nis the key.\r
</text>
<text id="14">
	Relay Run requires well-timed switching.\rDid you notice that Pokémon start to\nsweat a little when they become tired?\rIt also indicates they have slowed down\na lot.\rYou shouldn’t allow them to sweat.\rSwitching before they start to sweat,\nthat is the key.\r
</text>
<text id="15">
	It’s not easy to aim for the top\nby just tackling a lot in Ring Drop.\lDo you know what a “Body Attack” is?\rI call it a Body Attack, anyway...\rYour Pokémon can actually jump\nas it moves forward.\rIf you can let your Pokémon\nBody Attack others, you can drop\lthem off the Ring altogether!\r
</text>
<text id="16">
	Snow Throw is not just about smashing.\rAre you making sure the Snowballs\nare big?\rBigger Snowballs have a better\nchance of making other Pokémon\lfall down.\rYou can also block other Snowballs\nfrom hitting your Pokémon by having\lyour Pokémon hold on to\lsome Snowballs.\r
</text>
<text id="17">
	Goal Roll requires the skills of\na Pokéathlete.\rThe situation changes every second,\nbut stay calm as you instruct\lyour Pokémon.\rPositioning is key.\rI recommend keeping one at your own\nGoal to protect it--one in the middle of\lthe field for flexibility and one in\lfront of the Goal you want to\lroll the ball into.\r
</text>
<text id="18">
	I hope you’ll become a Top Pokéathlete.\nGood luck!

<text id="11">
	OK. OK.\nPicture your house in your mind...\r
</text>
<text id="12">
	OK... OK...\nThe best of luck to you!
</text>
<text id="13">
	ABRA: Aabra...
</text>
</file>

<text id="36">
	Thorton: Bzweeeeep!\rSorry, don’t mind me.\rWhat I’m using is an invention of mine.\nIt’s my data-interpreting machine.\rIt’s telling me what you’ve rented\nfor this match.\rI see! <text id="37">
	Thorton: Bzweeeeep!\rLet’s see what I can see about you\nthrough my data-interpreting machine.\rSo, what have you rented for this\nmatch...?\rI see! You’ve rented \v0100ぁ\x0000\x0000,\n\v0100ぁ\x0001\x0000, and \v0100ぁぁ\x0000.\rI have to admit, that’s a good setup.\rIt’s a combination of friendship with\ncooperation all around.\rI’d say it’s like \v0133ぁあ\x0000 percent?\lOh, don’t let that number concern you!\rAll righty, let’s get going!\nNo losing for me this time!\r
</text>
<text id="38">
	Thorton: Hmm...\nI got handed the loss here.\rIt’s not making me happy at all, losing.\nEven though I’m not happy, I did glean\lsome useful data, I suppose.\rThat makes me glad I battled you.\rSo, did you get to like those Pokémon\nyou rented?\rAs the Factory Head, it would sure make\nme happy if you did.\rNext time, come back with different\nrental Pokémon.\r
</text>
<text id="39">
	Thorton: Hmm...\nI got handed another loss.\rIt’s not making me happy at all, this.\nIn fact, I’m stewing here.\rI thought I learned a lot about\nPokémon since I lost to you.\rBut that’s all right.\nSome things you learn from winning.\lBut some things you learn by losing.\rI hope you’ll keep renting our Pokémon\nand give me a chance to redeem myself!\r
</text>
</file>

	Would you like to save this design?
</text>
<text id="3">
	There is no more space.
</text>

	You can see your Accessories on the\nleft side of the lower screen.\rTouch an Accessory, drag it to\nyour Pokémon on the right, and\lposition it securely.\rYou can put on ten Accessories,\nso you should check for the right\lones using the arrow buttons.\rChange the background with the\nsquare button at the center right.\rOK? <file id="219" change="false">
<text id="0">
	                                                                                
</text>
<text id="1">
	...\n...\rYaaaaaaawn...\n...\rHuh? It’s already become so\nbright outside!\r
</text>
<text id="2">
	...\n...\rYaaaaawn...\n...\rHuh? What?! Is it already that late?!\nOh no! I overslept!\r
</text>
<text id="3">
	...\n...\rHmm. Looks like the sun is descending\nin the sky...\r...So this would be what is called\n“twilight,” wouldn’t it?\r
</text>
<text id="4">
	...\n...\rHmm... Interesting...\n...\rHuh? Oh! Excuse me, sorry!\nI was just reading this book here.\r
</text>
<text id="5">
	...\n...\rYaaaaaaawn...\n...\rHuh? A guest?\nAt this hour?\r
</text>
<text id="6">
	Sorry to keep you waiting!\rWelcome to the world of Pokémon!\rMy name is Professor Oak.\rBut everyone calls me the\nPokémon Professor.\rBefore we go any further, I’d like to\ntell you a few things you should\lknow about this world!\r
</text>
<text id="7">
	I will first tell you important\nthings about this game.\n\nPlease touch any topic you’d like\nto know more about on the\nlower screen.
</text>
<text id="8">
	                                  
</text>
<text id="9">
	I’ll explain this game’s controls.\n\nYou can control this game by\ntouching the lower screen, also\ncalled the Touch Screen.\n\nPlease touch the panel in the\nbottom right of the Touch Screen.
</text>
<text id="10">
	By touching the Touch Screen\nlike this, you can confirm\nselections and advance\nconversations.
</text>
<text id="11">
	You can also advance by pressing\nthe A Button when you see the\nA Button icon on the Touch Screen.
</text>
<text id="12">
	Different touch buttons will appear\non the Touch Screen depending on\nthe situation.
</text>
<text id="13">
	Next, I’ll explain the button\noperations.\n\nYou can move the main character\naround on the screen using the\n+Control Pad.
</text>
<text id="14">
	Next, I’ll explain about buttons.\n\nUse the +Control Pad to move\nthe main character.\n\nYou can also use the +Control\nPad to select entries.
</text>
<text id="15">
	You can operate the screens using\nbuttons instead of touching the\nTouch Screen.
</text>
<text id="16">
	Used to confirm a choice, check\nthings, chat, and scroll text.\n\nUsed to exit, cancel a choice,\nand cancel a mode.
</text>
<text id="17">
	Use this to move within menus.\n\nPress to use a Key Item, such\nas a Bicycle, that has been\nregistered in advance.
</text>
<text id="18">
	                    
</text>
<text id="19">
	                                  
</text>
<text id="20">
	                                                                                                           
</text>
<text id="21">
	                                                        
</text>
<text id="22">
	                                                                     
</text>
<text id="23">
	If this mark is shown in the\nmessage window, there are active\nbuttons you can touch on the\nTouch Screen below.
</text>
<text id="24">
	                         
</text>
<text id="25">
	\v0200\x0001\x0000
</text>
<text id="26">
	Do you understand everything\nso far? \v0200\x0001\x0000
</text>
<text id="27">
	                                 
</text>
<text id="28">
	You are about to enter a world\nwhere you will embark on a grand\nadventure of your very own.
</text>
<text id="29">
	Speak to people and check things\nwherever you go, be it in towns,\nroads, or caves.\nGather information and hints from\nevery possible source.
</text>
<text id="30">
	New paths will open to you when\nyou help people in need, overcome\nchallenges, and solve mysteries.
</text>
<text id="31">
	At times, you will be challenged\nby others to a battle.\nAt other times, wild creatures\nmay stand in your way.\n\nBy overcoming such hurdles,\nyou will gain great power.
</text>
<text id="32">
	However, your adventure is not\nsolely about becoming powerful.
</text>
<text id="33">
	On your travels, we hope that\nyou will meet countless people\nand, through them, achieve\npersonal growth.\n\nThis is the most important\nobjective of this adventure.
</text>
<text id="34">
	This world is widely inhabited by\ncreatures known as Pokémon.\r
</text>
<text id="35">
	We humans live alongside Pokémon\nas friends.\rAt times we play together, and at\nother times we work together.\rSome people use their Pokémon to\nbattle and develop closer bonds\lwith them.\r
</text>
<text id="36">
	Now, why don’t you tell me a little bit\nabout yourself?\r
</text>
<text id="37">
	Are you a boy?\nOr are you a girl?\lWon’t you please tell me? \v0200\x0001\x0000
</text>
<text id="38">
	So, you’re a boy then? \v0200\x0001\x0000
</text>
<text id="39">
	So, you’re a girl then? \v0200\x0001\x0000
</text>
<text id="40">
	Please tell me your name.
</text>
<text id="41">
	Your name is \v0103ぁ\x0000\x0000? \v0200\x0001\x0000
</text>
<text id="42">
	Your name is \v0103ぁ\x0000\x0000? \v0200\x0001\x0000
</text>
<text id="43">
	\v0103ぁ\x0000\x0000!\nAre you ready?\rYour very own tale of grand adventure\nis about to unfold.\rFun experiences, difficult experiences,\nthere’s so much waiting for you!\rDreams! Adventure!\nLet’s go to the world of Pokémon!\rI’ll see you later!\r
</text>
<text id="44">
	CONTROL INFO
</text>
<text id="45">
	ADVENTURE INFO
</text>
<text id="46">
	NO INFO NEEDED
</text>
<text id="47">
	YES
</text>
<text id="48">
	NO
</text>

<text id="9">
	What would you like to do with\n\v0103ぁ\x0000\x0000’s Mail?
</text>
<text id="10">
	The message will be lost.\nIs that OK?
</text>
<text id="11">
	The message was erased.
</text>
<text id="12">
	Let a Pokémon hold this Mail?
</text>
<text id="13">
	The Mail’s message was erased,\nand it was put in the Bag.
</text>
<text id="14">
	Your Bag is full...\nThe Mail was discarded.
</text>

<text id="0">

<text id="197">
	\v0205\x0000Event Rules
</text>
<text id="198">
	Aim for the Goal and jump! Run!
</text>
<text id="199">
	Run, collect Pennants, and return!
</text>
<text id="200">
	Get in the Circle!
</text>
<text id="201">
	Break lots of Blocks!
</text>
<text id="202">
	Catch the flying Discs!
</text>
<text id="203">
	Jump and aim for the lit Lamps!
</text>
<text id="204">
	Run a Relay with Pokémon! Run!
</text>
<text id="205">
	Push your rivals out of the Ring!
</text>
<text id="206">
	Hit as many Pokémon as you can!
</text>
<text id="207">
	Get the ball in an opponent’s Goal!
</text>
<text id="208">
	\v0205\x0000Controls
</text>
<text id="209">
	Touch the Pokémon to jump!\nControl three Pokémon at the\nsame time. Jump the Hurdles!
</text>
<text id="210">
	In Hurdle Dash, you race against time to\nthe finish line. Jump over the Hurdles\nand be first to finish. Points are given\nbased on how many seconds it took all\nthree Pokémon to reach the finish line.\n\nSpeed: Running Speed\nJump: Jump Length
</text>
<text id="211">
	Touch the Pokémon to jump!\nJump to clear the Hurdles!\n\nControl three Pokémon at the same\ntime and finish before\neveryone else!
</text>
<text id="212">
	Slide the stylus over a\nPokémon to move it! Hit others\nfrom behind to take Pennants!
</text>
<text id="213">
	In Pennant Capture, your three Pokémon\nrun in turns to bring back Pennants.\nUp to nine Pennants can be held at\none time. Strike your opponents from\nbehind to steal their Pennants.\n\nSkill: Ease of Movement\nSpeed: Running Speed
</text>
<text id="214">
	Slide your stylus over your Pokémon\nquickly to move it!\nThe farther you slide, the more it moves!\n\nBe quicker than anyone else to\ngather as many Pennants as you\ncan and bring them back!
</text>
<text id="215">
	Use the stylus to move your\nPokémon around! Control\nthree Pokémon at once!
</text>
<text id="216">
	Circle Push is an event where you push\nyour opponent. If you are inside a Circle\nafter the timer has counted down,\nyou are awarded points. The number\nwritten in the Circle is the number of\npoints you will receive.\n\nPower: Push Power\nStamina: Ability to Keep Pushing
</text>
<text id="217">
	Use the stylus to move your\nPokémon around!\n\nControl three Pokémon at once and\naim for the Circle with the\nmost points!
</text>
<text id="218">
	Touch the Blocks to strike!\nTouch the Switch button to\nswitch to the next Pokémon!
</text>
<text id="219">
	Block Smash is simply an event where you\nsmash Blocks. Switch out your Pokémon\nas each becomes tired. You receive\npoints according to how many Blocks\nyou smash.\n\nPower: Destructive Power\nStamina: Ability to Keep Going
</text>
<text id="220">
	Touch the Blocks to smash them!\nThere’s a barrage of Blocks. Smash as\nmany as you can!\n\nTouch the Switch button to switch\nto the next Pokémon!
</text>
<text id="221">
	1) Use the stylus to move\nthree Pokémon around.\n2) Touch to jump and catch!
</text>
<text id="222">
	Disc Catch is an event where you control\nyour three Pokémon at the same time and\njump to catch Discs that come flying\nfrom the sea. The farther back in the\nstage that you catch the Discs, the\nmore points you get.\n\nJump: Jump Height\nPower: Push Power
</text>
<text id="223">
	1) Use the stylus to move your Pokémon\naround. Control three Pokémon at once.\nPush your opponents out of the way to\ncatch the Discs!\n\n2) Touch your Pokémon lightly to\njump! Catch as many Discs\nas you can!
</text>
<text id="224">
	Quickly pull the Pokémon\ndown to jump!
</text>
<text id="225">
	In Lamp Jump, you control your three\nPokémon as they try to jump and touch\nthe Lamps as they light. Try to touch as\nmany Lamps as you can in one jump.\n\nJump: Jump Height\nSkill: Ability to Jump Sideways
</text>
<text id="226">
	Quickly pull the three Pokémon down and\nwatch them jump!\n\nPull them diagonally to have them\njump to the side!
</text>
<text id="227">
	Quickly flick to dash! Flick as\nfast as you can to go faster!\nSwitch when you’re tired!
</text>
<text id="228">
	Relay Run is an event where you move from\nPokémon to Pokémon, trying to run\nas far as you can. Switch your Pokémon\nwhen they’re tired. Points will be\nawarded based only on the distance run.\n\nStamina: Endurance\nSpeed: Running Speed
</text>
<text id="229">
	Quickly flick the stylus to the right to\nget your Pokémon to dash!\n\nThe more you flick to the right, the\nfaster your Pokémon will go!\n\nTouch the Switch button to\nswitch to the next Pokémon!
</text>
<text id="230">
	1) Use the stylus to move.\n2) Quickly flick to tackle!\n3) Lightly touch to jump!
</text>
<text id="231">
	Ring Drop is an event where you push\nyour opponent. You get points each time\nyou push your opponent out of the Ring.\nIf you push the Switch button in your\ncorner, you can switch Pokémon.\n\nStamina: Ability to Resist Pushing\nPower: Tackle Strength
</text>
<text id="232">
	1) Use the stylus to move your Pokémon!\n\n2) Quickly flick the stylus to tackle!\nBlow your opponent away!\n\n3) Lightly touch your\nPokémon to get them to jump!\nYour Pokémon can stomp on others!
</text>
<text id="233">
	1) Quickly flick upward on\nyour Pokémon to throw Snow!\n2) Touch to hoard more Snow!
</text>
<text id="234">
	In Snow Throw, you control three of your\nPokémon at the same time and hit your\nopponents with Snowballs. You’ll receive\npoints no matter who you hit on your\nopponent’s team.\n\nSkill: Throwing Accuracy\nPower: Snowball Strength
</text>
<text id="235">
	1) Flick upward on your Pokémon to\nthrow a Snowball!\n\n2) When holding a Snowball, touch the\nPokémon to make the Snowball bigger!\n\nBigger Snowballs can make your\nopponent faint on impact!
</text>
<text id="236">
	1) Control three Pokémon! Use\nthe stylus to move around!\n2) Flick quickly to dash!
</text>
<text id="237">
	In Goal Roll, you try to get the ball into\nyour opponent’s Goal. It doesn’t matter\nwhich of their Goals--you’ll earn points.\nBut if the ball ends up in your own Goal,\nyou’ll lose points.\n\nSkill: Rolling Length\nPower: Rolling Strength
</text>
<text id="238">
	1) Control three Pokémon at once. Use\nthe stylus to move your Pokémon!\n\n2) Flick quickly with the stylus to\ndash! If you’re dashing, then\nyou can shoot for the Goal!
</text>

<file id="311" change="false">
<text id="0">
	Wow, you’re energetic and hardworking!\nI won’t get tricked by your cuteness!\r
</text>
<text id="1">
	Don’t eat the grass along the road of\nlife! My personal slogan!\r
</text>
<text id="2">
	Together with these three Pokémon I’ll\nget stronger! I’ll get bigger!\r
</text>
<text id="3">
	Do you think you can keep up with me?\nThey call me the “Victorious Victor”!\r
</text>
<text id="4">
	Jump! Fight! Be like the wind!\nSomeday I want to fly high!\r
</text>
<text id="5">
	Behind that cute face lies hidden\npower! You’ll see it with your own eyes!\r
</text>
<text id="6">
	This is our team!\nThis is our power!\r
</text>
<text id="7">
	Power is strength! Strength is power!\nI’ll use that power to climb to the top!\r
</text>
<text id="8">
	Do you know me!? Do you know what kind\nof hidden talents I have?!\r
</text>
<text id="9">
	A Pokémon’s strength and power...\nI’ll show them to you!\r
</text>
<text id="10">
	Pokémon’s friendship and affection! If\nyou’ve got that, you’ll never lose!\r
</text>
<text id="11">
	My Pokémon are always protecting me!\nSo there’s no way that we’ll lose!\r
</text>
<text id="12">
	The accuracy of Bug-type Pokémon!\nI’m a man who knows all about them!\r
</text>
<text id="13">
	That skill is like a well-oiled machine!\nThe result of the calculation is...!\r
</text>
<text id="14">
	Do you know the skill of\nthese Pokémon?!\r
</text>
<text id="15">
	Never crumble, no matter what happens!\nThat’s the kind of friendship we’ve got!\r
</text>
<text id="16">
	That kind of tenacity is common in\neveryone! That spirit! That gutsiness!\r
</text>
<text id="17">
	On the mountain five years together...\nThe friendship is everlasting!\r
</text>
<text id="18">
	Master fighting! Live for fighting!\nAnd live for the Pokéathlon!\r
</text>
<text id="19">
	I can see victory! That’s because I\ndon’t think there’s any way I’ll lose!\r
</text>
<text id="20">
	I can fly with these Pokémon so far!\nOver the rainbow!\r
</text>
<text id="21">
	Jump to victory!\nJump to the other side of victory!\r
</text>
<text id="22">
	Why can you jump that high?!\nSimple, it’s because it’s all you can do.\r
</text>
<text id="23">
	We’re not done. We’re just beginning!\nWe’ll show you just how far we can jump!\r
</text>
<text id="24">
	Flying is like breathing to me!\nThat’s only natural, if you ask me.\r
</text>
<text id="25">
	It’s impossible to measure that speed!\nA legendary team known for speed!\r
</text>
<text id="26">
	Finally here! The amazingly persistent\nGym Leader! How much true power?\r
</text>
<text id="27">
	Cuteness, strength, and speed!\nA girl with sparkle!\r
</text>
<text id="28">
	Nothing in front of this guy... Even a\nbolt of lightning can come from behind!\r
</text>
<text id="29">
	Run! The thing beyond that--the goal\nis called friendship!\r
</text>
<text id="30">
	The famous guy on the TV all the time\nis now participating in the Pokéathlon!\r
</text>
<text id="31">
	All right! The cute and energetic Gym\nLeader from the Sinnoh region!\r
</text>
<text id="32">

<text id="12">
	The Pokéathlon is a sports festival in\nwhich you and three Pokémon compete in\lthree events.\rThe Pokéathlon has a variety of events\nto accommodate different aspects\lof Pokémon.\rPlease come join us with three Pokémon!\r
</text>
<text id="13">
	The Supreme Cup is a special course\nonly for the top Pokéathletes\lfrom all over the world.\rYou will earn more points than usual\nwhen you win a Supreme Cup!\rPlease, challenge the\ntop Pokéathletes!\r
</text>
<text id="14">
	The Speed Course consists of three\nevents that require good\lSpeed Performance.\r“Hurdle Dash”\nJump over the Hurdles to be\lnumber one!\r“Pennant Capture”\nCapture Pennants quickly!\r“Relay Run”\nShow your teamwork!\rWhen you win, you will be awarded\nthe Speed Medal.\rChoose three Pokémon with good Speed\nfor these events.\r
</text>
<text id="15">
	The Power Course consists of three\nevents that require good\lPower Performance.\r“Block Smash”\nSmash all the Blocks!\r“Circle Push”\nPush them out while you stay in!\r“Goal Roll”\nDrive them out and roll the balls\ltoward the Goal!\rWhen you win, you will be awarded\nthe Power Medal.\rChoose three Pokémon with good Power\nfor these events.\r
</text>
<text id="16">
	The Stamina Course consists of three\nevents that require good\lStamina Performance.\r“Ring Drop”\nBlow them away and stay on the Ring!\r“Relay Run”\nThe Stamina of all three is key!\r“Block Smash”\lSmash away as long as your\nStamina holds!\rWhen you win, you will be awarded\nthe Stamina Medal.\rChoose three Pokémon with good Stamina\nfor these events.\r
</text>
<text id="17">
	The Jump Course consists of three\nevents that require good\lJump Performance.\r“Lamp Jump”\nJump to the sky and hit Lamps!\r“Disc Catch”\nJump and catch flying Discs!\r“Hurdle Dash”\nJump over the Hurdles cleanly!\rWhen you win, you will be awarded\nthe Jump Medal.\rChoose three Pokémon with good Jump\nfor these events.\r
</text>
<text id="18">
	The Skill Course consists of three\nevents that require good\lTechnique Performance.\r“Snow Throw”\nAim for them and throw Snow!\r“Goal Roll”\nRoll the balls into the Goal!\r“Pennant Capture”\nMake a quick turn and grab Pennants!\rWhen you win, you will be awarded\nthe Skill Medal.\rChoose three Pokémon with good Skill\nfor these events.\r
</text>
<text id="19">

<text id="38">
	Welcome. This is the reception for the\nLink Pokéathlon.\rOh, my!\nThis is your first time, isn’t it?\rIf that’s true, then please head over\nto the “Single” reception.\rIf you go to the right from here, it’s\nthe middle counter.\rYou can get information about the\nPokéathlon and decide on a course.
</text>
<text id="39">
	The Link Pokéathlon is a sport festival\nin which you join with three of your\lPokémon to compete in four events.\rYour friends can join the same events\nto compete.\rThe Pokéathlon has a variety of events\nto accommodate many of the different\laspects of Pokémon.\rPlease bring your friends to the\nLink Pokéathlon.\r
</text>
<text id="40">
	The Speed \and Jump Course consists of\nfour events that require good\lSpeed and Jump Performance.\r“Hurdle Dash”\nJump over the Hurdles to be\lnumber one!\r“Lamp Jump”\nTake the Lamps quickly!\r“Disc Catch”\nCatch the Discs rapidly!\r“Relay Run”\nSuperb Speed is highly required!\rWhen you win, you will be awarded\nthe Speed Medal and the Jump Medal.\rChoose three Pokémon with good\nSpeed and Jump for these events, and\lbring your friends as well.\r
</text>
<text id="41">
	The Jump \and Skill Course consists of\nfour events that require good\lJump and Skill Performance.\r“Lamp Jump”\nShow your skill in jumping to\ltouch the Lamps!\r“Disc Catch”\nJump and catch the Discs!\r“Pennant Capture”\nShow your moves and collect Pennants!\r“Snow Throw”\nAim with accuracy!\rWhen you win, you will be awarded\nthe Jump Medal and the Skill Medal.\rChoose three Pokémon with good\nJump and Skill for these events, and\lbring your friends as well.\r
</text>
<text id="42">
	The Skill \and Power Course consists of\nfour events that require good\lSkill and Power Performance.\r“Goal Roll”\nAim at the Goal and shoot!\r“Snow Throw”\nSteady, aim, and fire away!\r“Pennant Capture”\nShow your moves and collect Pennants!\r“Block Smash”\nBlocks keep coming! Smash them all!\rWhen you win, you will be awarded\nthe Skill Medal and the Power Medal.\rChoose three Pokémon with good\nSkill and Power for these events, and\lbring your friends as well.\r
</text>
<text id="43">
	The Power \and Stamina Course consists\nof four events that require good\lPower and Stamina Performance.\r“Block Smash”\nBlocks keep coming! Smash them all!\r“Circle Push”\nPush them away and stay in the Circle!\r“Goal Roll”\nKeep rolling until your energy\lruns out!\r“Ring Drop”\nDrop them off the Ring and stay on top!\rWhen you win, you will be awarded\nthe Power Medal and the Stamina Medal.\rChoose three Pokémon with good\nPower and Stamina for these events,\land bring your friends as well.\r
</text>
<text id="44">
	The Stamina \and Speed Course consists\nof four events that require good\lStamina and Speed Performance.\r“Relay Run”\nBoth Stamina and Speed are key!\r“Ring Drop”\nDrop them from high while you survive!\r“Hurdle Dash”\nOver you go! Aim for number one!\r“Circle Push”\nPush them away and stay in the Circle!\rWhen you win, you will be awarded\nthe Stamina Medal and the Speed Medal.\rChoose three Pokémon with good Stamina\nand Speed for these events, and\lbring your friends as well.\r
</text>
<text id="45">
	The Master Course is a difficult course\nthat offers different events\levery time.\rTeams must do their best to get\nthrough the course, no matter what it\lmay be!\rYou won’t receive any medals for a\nMaster Course.\rHowever, you will receive twice as many\nAthlete Points.\rBy all means, get your friends together\nand give it a try.\r
</text>

Ta-da!\nThe wind that blows through the town!\nThere’s a wind that will suddenly blast\nthrough the town, as residents know.\nMoving on, number two is... Ta-da!\nThe weather vanes!\nThe weather vanes posted around the\ntown allow us to be proactive in\npredicting when the wind will blow\nthrough the town.\nAnd the number one thing is... Ta-da!\nProfessor Elm’s Laboratory!\nProfessor Elm’s doing great research on\nPokémon as companions, and so we’re\nlisting his Lab as splendid number one!
</text>
<text id="5">
	Announcing the top 3 in\nCherrygrove City!\nNumber three is... Ta-da!\nThe little flower beds!\nThis town has many little flower beds\nscattered around, making the town that\nmuch more beautiful.\nAnd the number one thing is... 	Announcing the top 3 in Violet City!\nNumber three is... Ta-da!\nThe arched bridge!\nThis bridge extends over the river\nrunning through the town, and is so\nround it reminds the residents of a drum.\nMoving on, number two is... Ta-da!\nThe stylish Pokémon Center!\nThis Pokémon Center is painted in natural\ncolors so as to blend in with the\nbeautiful scenery around it, rather than\nstanding out. It’s strict, which is why it’s\npopular, and that’s why it’s our splendid\nnumber one!

Ta-da!\nThe Bellchime Trail!\nThe trail to the Bell Tower is always\ndecorated in shades of autumn for some\nreason, and is quite the\nmagnificent sight!\nRegular people are not allowed to\nenter, but it is still very popular, and\nthat’s why it’s our splendid number one!

<text id="0">
	Pokémon Search Party
</text>
<text id="1">
	Narrator
</text>
<text id="2">
	What has our fearless staff witnessed?\nIt’s the Pokémon Search Party!
</text>
<text id="3">
	The Variety Channel that’s a treasure\ntrove of laughter and tears!
</text>
<text id="4">
	At the end of the day, our search\nparty’s efforts were in vain.\nThey eventually had to leave the deep\nand dark Union Cave.\n“If only we had Flash!” the leader cried.\nTune in next time for the exciting\nconclusion to the special program,\n“The Cave Plunged into Darkness”!
</text>
<text id="5">
	At the end of the day, our search\nparty’s efforts were in vain.\nWe weren’t able to find any UNOWN...\nTune in next time for the exciting\nconclusion in the special program,\n“Solving the UNOWN Puzzle!”
</text>
<text id="6">
	The search-party leader looked up at\nthe Johto sky and shouted a promise.\n“We won’t fail again!”\nIt mixed with the sad cries of the\nSLOWPOKE that echoed continuously...\nYawn... Yaaawn...\nTune in next time for the exciting\nconclusion in the special program, “The\nDark Shadow that Kidnapped SLOWPOKE!”
</text>
<text id="7">
	The forest was dark and gloomy. We could\nhear the crunching of fallen leaves under\nour feet.\n“Leader, this is a dead end!”\n“Don’t worry, let’s retrace our steps.”\n“Where’s the exit?”\n“Come on, we can do it!”\n“Let’s just go back already...”\n“You’re a guy, aren’t you? Quit whining!”\n“Leader, your back...”\n“What?!”\n“On your back, a Bug-type Pokémon...”\n“Eeeeek!”\nTune in next time for the exciting\nconclusion in the special program,\n“Great Strategy in Ilex Forest!”
</text>
<text id="8">
	The leader of the search party looked\nout at the Lake of Rage, quietly\nmuttering “There’s no such thing as\nunstoppable rain.”\nHe held the Fishing Rod that had been\nsnapped in two tightly in his hand, and\nheaded back to headquarters.\nTune in next time for the exciting\nconclusion in the special program,\n“Look! A Red Gyarados!”
</text>
<text id="9">
	The inside of the cave was covered in\na thick ice, just like a freezer.\n“Aaaahchoooo!”\nThe search party members shivered\nin the cold, and huddled around the\nfiery PONYTA for warmth.\nThey were able to beat the cold...\nTune in next time for the exciting\nconclusion in the special program,\n“The Shivering Path Out of Ice!”
</text>
<text id="10">
	The voyaging search party tried to\nthink of a solution to the puzzle, but\ntheir thoughts were interrupted and\nwashed away by the sound of the waves\naround the Whirl Islands.\nThe shadow of a huge Pokémon shifted and\nshook in the violent sea filled with\nwhirlpools...\nTune in next time for the exciting\nconclusion in the special program, “The\nLegend Disappeared into the Whirlpool!”
</text>
<text id="11">
	The forest was brighter than they\nthought it would be.\nAnd they saw so many Trainers there.\n“Hey, a Bug Catcher!”\n“What?”\n“He’s challenged us to a battle!”\n“Then accept his challenge!”\n“But we don’t have any Pokémon...”\n“Simpleton!”\nTune in next time for the exciting\nconclusion in the special program,\n“The Viridian Forest Search Party!”
</text>
<text id="12">
	We heard that there were Pokémon here,\nbut we haven’t seen any yet.\nWe’ve come all the way here to Mt. Moon,\nas a search party looking for Pokémon.\nWe’ve been waiting, spending time here,\nand yet the day that we see a Pokémon\nhasn’t come yet...\nWhen will we see one? What kind of\nPokémon will come to Mt. Moon?\nTune in next time for the exciting\nconclusion in the special program,\n“Rumors on Mt. Moon!”
</text>
<text id="13">
	The members of the Pokémon search\nparty are riding their Bicycles on\nRoute 17 and singing.\nLooking at their faces, they seem to be\nrelaxing and cycling along as\nthey please.\nBut they’re actually doing this to search\nfor the Pokémon along the route.\nTune in next time for the exciting\nconclusion in the special program,\n“Illusion Cycling!”
</text>
<text id="14">
	The search party has become lost!\nIn this strange world, up has become\ndown, and left has become right!\nThen suddenly, right before the confused\nsearch party’s eyes, it appears!\nGIRATINA!\nThere’re so few accounts of anyone ever\nmeeting this Pokémon. It rarely appears.\nBut comparing GIRATINA to the few\nrecords that exist, it’s appearance\nis different...\nTune in next time for the exciting\nconclusion in the special program,\n“The Strange GIRATINA!”
</text>
<text id="15">
	The search party has gone on a long\nexpedition out to the Sinnoh region.\nThe giant Mt. Coronet, rising up to the\nsky from the middle of Sinnoh...\nWithin Mt. Coronet stretches a complex\nsystem of caverns...\nSome members of the search party\nstruggled through the caverns,\nonly to ultimately arrive at a\nbroken bridge.\nThey thought they’d found ancient ruins.\nThere was a strange feeling in the air...\nTune in next time for the exciting\nconclusion in the special program,\n“Found it! The Illusion Space!”
</text>
<text id="16">
	The search party had just about\nreached the limits of its physical\nstrength, when it came to Cerulean\nCity to rest.\n“Look, such a beautiful sunset...”\n“Leader! Look over there!”\nThe member was pointing at a\nsuspicious-looking cave!\nThe search party went to explore, and\nfound a strange flickering shadow...\nTune in next time for the exciting\nconclusion in the special program,\n“The True Shape of the Cave’s Owner!”
</text>

<text id="1">
	Snap

<text id="2">
	We’re always watching you!\nIt’s time for Trainer Profiles!
</text>
<text id="3">
	That town, this town,\nbringing people together.\nThe Street Corner Channel.
</text>
<text id="4">
	This boy loves Bug types! He’s so\nenergetic, and he doesn’t mind running\nthrough thick grass to catch Bug-type\nPokémon! He does what he wants, on the\nhills and in the fields, this Bug Catcher!
</text>
<text id="5">
	These two are always together.\nThey have the same birthday.\nThey always eat together.\nDo you think you can tell them apart?\nThese Twins!
</text>
<text id="6">
	Flying majestically through the sky.\nRejecting the land for the open air.\nGracefully flapping its wings. Riding the\nwind to soar high into the sky.\nI want to fly there, too, sometime!\nThe Bird Keeper!
</text>
<text id="7">
	Singing in the cabin.\nLaa... Laa... La la la la...\nThe plan is to take a three-night, four-\nday holiday. To fish off the boat, hike\nin the mountains, and look for EEVEE to\nthe east and west. That’s the Camper!
</text>
<text id="8">
	Greeting you with a peace sign, stuffing\ndrinks into a cooler, smiling brightly\nwhile hiking through the mountains, you\ncan see her clearly on the horizon.\nOh no! Forgot the lunchbox! The number\none rule is to protect nature.\nThe Picnicker!
</text>
<text id="9">
	Accidentally inhaling a little ocean\nwater, he now has a sore nose. Swimming\naround the rocks, pushing ahead with a\nbreaststroke, tirelessly swimming along,\nand getting a leg cramp! His lungs\nexpand easily but it’s an unlucky day--\nit’s raining! That poor Swimmer!
</text>
<text id="10">
	A silhouette like that of Venus. An\nadorably dazzling smile. A nickname of\n“Mermaid.” Swimming around carefree in\nthe early afternoon. Feeling hungry but\non a diet. The number of enthusiastic\nfans. Droplets of water in her dimples.\nPlaying in the water rather than taking\na walk, this Swimmer!
</text>
<text id="11">
	Dropping a line in the cold water, in\nthe hopes of catching something big.\nThe line is yanked. The float drops\nunderwater. What was caught? Some lively\nrubber boots! This poor Fisherman!
</text>
<text id="12">
	The day has come to an end, but it’s still\nbright. That’s strange, you’d think.\nThere’s an intense fire burning, and it\nlooks like it’s going to burn them.\nHe doesn’t need a candle. He’s a human\nablaze, carelessly playing with fire.\nThe Firebreather!
</text>
<text id="13">
	This is so cool isn’t it, this Pokémon?\nThe tail is such a great shape.\nWant to trade figurines? Want to come\nover and see my collection?\nOh hey! This mark is in the wrong place.\nLooks like I fell for a counterfeit...\nBut it’s art anyway!\nThat’s a Poké Maniac!
</text>
<text id="14">
	I can break ten roof tiles in one chop!\nSome people think I’m just a hooligan.\nThe palm of my hand becomes covered\nin blisters. I never forget to bow, and\nI shout out to psych myself up!\nI’m the Black Belt!
</text>
<text id="15">
	Hold it close, cheek to cheek. I always\nwant to be with you, surrounded by\nwonderful Pokémon. I’ll mutter your\nname. So happy, I’m dizzy.\nI love Pokémon! That’s a Pokéfan!
</text>
<text id="16">
	A strong guy on a boat, plunging on\nthrough the waves. Dancing and singing\nand having a merry old time. But gentle\nas kittens once they get back on land.\nThat’s a Sailor!
</text>
<text id="17">
	Had plenty of success. Learning through\nconstant repetition. Recklessly carrying\naround notebooks. Attending classes\nfor gifted kids.\nA wonderful Pokémon Trainer, that\nSchool Kid!
</text>
<text id="18">
	Hey kid, get out of my way! If you hang\naround, I’ll smack you! Get out of the\nway. Out of the way. My Bike is coming\nthrough! It’s so very loud, you’ll cover\nyour ears! We’ll line up and get in the\nway. Go ahead. Try to stop us Bikers!
</text>
<text id="19">
	Yaho... Yaho... Yahohoho...\nSinging in a loud voice without worrying\nabout what’s around. A bearded man\nshouts out to the sky. From the far\nmountain. Yahohoho... So happy that the\necho came back to the Hiker!
</text>

<text id="40">
	\v0205\x0000DELETE RECORD
</text>
<text id="41">
	\v0205\x0000RETURN
</text>
<text id="42">
	\v0132ぁ\x0000\x0000.
</text>
<text id="43">
	\v0103ぁ\x0001\x0000
</text>
<text id="44">
	\v0135ぁ\x0000\x0000 wins
</text>
<text id="45">
	\v0132ぁ\x0000\x0000 wins
</text>
<text id="46">
	\v0137ぁ\x0000\x0000
</text>
<text id="47">
	\v0137ぁ\x0000\x0000
</text>
<text id="48">
	Select the record you want to\ndelete, then press the A or X Button.
</text>
<text id="49">
	Delete \v0103ぁ\x0000\x0000’s record?\nAre you sure?
</text>

</text>
<text id="51">
	   
</text>

	Your own record can’t be deleted.
</text>

<text id="0">
	\v0103ぁ\x0000\x0000
</text>
<text id="1">
	ID: \v0136ぁ\x0000\x0000
</text>
<text id="2">
	When the group is ready:\nA Button: Proceed   B Button: Cancel
</text>
<text id="3">
	Are these members OK?
</text>
<text id="4">
	Cancel record mixing?
</text>
<text id="5">
	Record mixing will be canceled.
</text>
<text id="6">
	There is a member who can no\nlonger remain available.
</text>
<text id="7">
	There are no members.\nRecord mixing will be canceled.
</text>
<text id="8">
	Please wait.\n... ... B Button: Cancel
</text>
<text id="9">
	A member is no longer available.\nRecord mixing will be canceled.
</text>
<text id="10">
	Cancel record mixing?
</text>
<text id="11">
	Record mixing will be canceled.
</text>
<text id="12">
	Mixing records...\nDon’t turn off the power!
</text>
<text id="13">
	Record mixing completed!\nReturning to the Union Room.
</text>
<text id="14">
	If the leader quits, the group will\ndisband. Is that OK?
</text>
<text id="15">
	\v0103ぁ\x0000\x0000 has left.
</text>
<text id="16">
	\v0101ぁ\x0000\x0000 the leader has left.\nThe group will disband.
</text>
<text id="17">
	Seeking record-mixing friends!
</text>
<text id="18">
	Record mixing under way!
</text>

	Dahlia: No need to worry. ♪\nLet chance do what it does.\rLike surprises from the game board,\nlife goes through twists and turns.\rNo need to worry. ♪\nThings will go as they will.\rBut, enough of that.\nI know one thing for certain.\rYou have arrived here not merely\nbecause you were lucky.\rLet us not waste any time.\nI wish to test your skills myself!\r
</text>
<text id="78">
	Dahlia: No need to worry. ♪\nLet chance do what it does.\rLike surprises from the game board,\nlife goes through twists and turns.\rNo need to worry. ♪\nThings will go as they will.\rBut, enough of that.\nYou are proving yourself incredible.\rAre you incredible because you are so\nlucky you shrug off bad luck entirely?\rOr, are you so incredibly talented to\nnot be swayed by luck, good or bad?\rI wish to see for myself what brought\nyou to me today!\r
</text>
<text id="79">

</text>
<text id="80">

<text id="0">
	I’m the Day-Care Man.\rWe look after the precious Pokémon\nof other Trainers.\rIf you’d like us to raise your\nPokémon, have a word with my wife.
</text>
<text id="1">
	Ah, it’s you!\rWe were raising your Pokémon,\nand my goodness, were we surprised!\rYour Pokémon was holding an Egg!\rWe don’t know how it got there,\nbut your Pokémon had it.\rYou do want it, don’t you? \v0200\x0001\x0000
</text>
<text id="2">

</text>

</text>
<text id="24">
	Will you battle the \v010Fぁ\x0000\x0000-type,\nRank \v0133ぁ\x0001\x0000 Pokémon?
</text>
<text id="25">

<text id="26">

<text id="27">
	  
</text>
<text id="28">
	   
</text>
<text id="29">
	 
</text>
<text id="30">
	 
</text>
<text id="31">
	Will you battle against the Hall Matron?
</text>
<text id="32">
	Excuse me!\nPlease hold on a moment.\rIn recognition of your remarkable\nwinning streak, our Frontier Brain is\ldemanding a match with you.\rActually, you have no choice.\nYou must battle our Hall Matron!\r
</text>
<text id="33">
	Argenta: My Battle Hall allows Trainers\nto mount challenges with their one\lpreferred Pokémon.\rI imagine there were tense moments\ngetting here with your chosen one.\rBut understand that one shines the\nbrightest when a challenge is overcome.\rI am Argenta, and I am your final and\nmost daunting challenge.\rI dare you to overcome my challenge.\r
</text>
<text id="34">
	Argenta: Well!\nMy goodness, your Pokémon...\lIt’s got star power beyond belief.\rEven from inside its Poké Ball, I can\nfeel its charismatic brilliance.\rBut I’m the Hall Matron.\nI’ll be the judge of that.\rI must battle it for myself and see if\nthat brilliance is genuine.\rThat is why we must battle now.\r
</text>
<text id="35">
	Argenta: A good Trainer doesn’t force\ntheir preferred Pokémon on anyone.\rA good one keeps with their favorite\nwithout drama or fanfare.\rThat is how I see it, at least.\rAnd, by the way I see it, you’re an\nexcellent Trainer!\rBe sure to visit the Battle Hall again\nwith a favorite Pokémon.\rUntil then, bye-bye!\r
</text>
<text id="36">
	Argenta: You must never forget there\nis a place where everyone can shine.\rThat goes for any and every kind of\nPokémon, too.\rSpread that message in your own words.\nIt’s one everyone should hear.\rAnd now, having lost, this lady has\nnothing left to say at all, but...\rBye-bye!\r
</text>
<text id="37">
	Please select what type of Pokémon\nyou’d like to battle.
</text>

<text id="33">
	USE

<text id="34">

	You can be patient in a battle.\nVictory will come eventually.\r
</text>
<text id="770">
	I’ll keep to my own pace.\nI’ll catch up to you one day.\r
</text>
<text id="771">
	I only have this Bike to look good for\nthe guys. I can’t actually ride.
</text>
<text id="772">
	It was a pain getting this Bike here.\nI had to push it all the way!\r
</text>
<text id="773">
	I’m only concerned about looking good.\nI don’t practice enough.\r
</text>
<text id="774">
	I’m not looking for any excitement.\nI don’t need any drama.
</text>
<text id="775">
	A battle is all the excitement I need.\r
</text>
<text id="776">
	I recently realized that I’m not cut\nout for this scary job.\r
</text>
<text id="777">
	I’ll battle my way.\nYou battle yours.
</text>
<text id="778">
	People are people.\nI’ll go my own way.\r
</text>
<text id="779">
	People are people.\nYou go your own way.\r
</text>
<text id="780">
	Today, I have a special treat for all\nmy fans!
</text>
<text id="781">
	Thank you!\nI love your support!\r
</text>
<text id="782">
	Are you really one of my fans?\r
</text>
<text id="783">
	I’m burnt out on being an Idol.\nI want to go home to the country...
</text>
<text id="784">
	I can’t quit now!\nKids dream of being me!\r
</text>
<text id="785">
	I miss hearing my mother’s voice...\r
</text>
<text id="786">
	I’m one of a kind.\nThat’s what I’m saying.
</text>
<text id="787">
	I keep it real.\nThat’s what makes me tough.\r
</text>
<text id="788">
	I kept it real, but you won anyway.\nYour reality was more real.\r
</text>
<text id="789">
	Hi! Are you my next opponent?\nLet’s keep it clean and fair!
</text>
<text id="790">
	It feels great going all out with no\ndirty tricks.\r
</text>
<text id="791">
	That was an awesome workout!\nWe have to do this again sometime!\r
</text>
<text id="792">
	My needs are simple.\nFishing and Moomoo Milk are all I need.
</text>
<text id="793">
	Winning or losing isn’t something I pay\nheed to.\r
</text>
<text id="794">
	I could use some Moomoo Milk right\nabout now.\r
</text>
<text id="795">
	You there! Take a look at the Pokémon\nI fished up the other day.
</text>
<text id="796">
	I can tell you’re impressed. This guy,\nI don’t know how long it took to land.\r
</text>
<text id="797">
	A word of advice: when an older person\nis bragging, pretend to be interested.\r
</text>
<text id="798">
	You’re a Trainer.\nLet your Pokémon do the talking.
</text>
<text id="799">
	Where’s your spirit?\nThat didn’t speak to me at all.\r
</text>
<text id="800">
	Great! Great!\nYour feelings came across!\r
</text>
<text id="801">
	Here comes your prey!\nGet ’em! Chaaaarge!
</text>
<text id="802">
	Gaahahaha!\nThat’s it! Good job!\r
</text>
<text id="803">
	We’re outmatched!\nPull back, guys! Run away!\r
</text>
<text id="804">
	Bring it on!\nOoooh! Haaah!
</text>
<text id="805">
	Thank you kindly!\r
</text>
<text id="806">
	Thanks for having me!\r
</text>
<text id="807">
	I am captivated by the mountains.\nThey’re the main thing in my life!
</text>
<text id="808">
	The mountains mean more to me\nthan any battle, no matter how fun!\r
</text>
<text id="809">
	Your battle skills are impressive, but I\ncan’t wait to return to the mountains.\r
</text>
<text id="810">
	We’re going to hammer you, kid.\nDon’t freeze up and close your eyes.
</text>
<text id="811">
	I like how you stay defiant even after\nlosing. Good attitude, kid.\r
</text>
<text id="812">
	Honest, I didn’t let up one bit or let\ndown my guard because you’re a kid.\r
</text>
<text id="813">
	I battle around the globe.\nI’m a worldwide bad boy!
</text>
<text id="814">
	I don’t lose at battling.\nI can’t get over how cool I am!\r
</text>
<text id="815">
	I’m hitting the road over that loss.\nIt’s good-bye to the old me!\r
</text>
<text id="816">
	Battles, I’m good at.\nBut musical aptitude? Forget it.
</text>
<text id="817">
	This whole battling thing is good, but\nI wish I could play music as well.\r
</text>
<text id="818">
	Music or Pokémon...\nIt’s a tough choice.\r
</text>
<text id="819">
	I wrote a song using the cries of\nPokémon. I’d like you to hear it.
</text>
<text id="820">
	Graaah wagyaaah! Wagyaaaah!\nChu! Chu! Gyaroooh-gah!\r

<text id="821">

<text id="822">

</text>
<text id="823">
